titlestmt.titleproper: Office of the Messrs. Rockefeller records, Housing Interests, Series J
A Guide to the Office of the Messrs. Rockefeller records, Housing Interests, Series J FA319

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-10-01 04:13:58 UTC.

did.unittitle: Office of the Messrs. Rockefeller records, Housing Interests, Series J

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Material in the Rockefeller family collections that provides the names, correspondence, or activities of living members of the Rockefeller family, and/or documents the net wealth of any Rockefeller family members, is restricted. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Housing Files comprise 8 cubic feet of material covering the years 1896-1962. The bulk of the material relates to John D. Rockefeller, Jr.'s activities in the housing field during the 1920s and 1930s. However, there are significant sections which detail the interests of Mr. Rockefeller, Sr. in Cleveland and New York City, and David Rockefeller in the Morningside Heights project. A few scattered files cover the activities of Messrs. John, Nelson, and Laurance Rockefeller in this field. Substantively, these files deal with Mr. Rockefeller, Jr.'s involvement with housing reform and housing projects during two distinct time periods: the period of great optimism and activity during the 1920s, and the period of destabilization and disengagement from the field after the coming of the New Deal and into the 1940s.

These files focus on eight major housing developments: Forest Hill Estates in Cleveland; the City Housing Corporation's efforts at Sunnyside Gardens in Queens; Thomas Garden Apartments in the Bronx; Paul Laurance Dunbar Housing in Harlem; Lavoisier Apartments in Manhattan; Van Tassel Apartments in Tarrytown; and Radburn in New Jersey. For each of these developments, the files contain comprehensive information on the origin of the project, financing, construction, architecture, relations with government officials, taxation, and problems in operation after completion. Memoranda and other correspondence, including copies of deeds, indentures, and contracts, dealing with both purchase and sale, are also included. Interspersed throughout the specific project folders is correspondence with prominent individuals in the housing field, politicians, and businessmen. The most significant among these are Richard T. Ely, Alexander Bing of the City Housing Corporation, Lawrence Veiller and Robert DeForest of the New York City Housing Commission, Harold Ickes, Governor Alfred E. Smith, Jesse Jones of the Reconstruction Finance Corporation and Mayors Walker, Hyland, and LaGuardia.

Each of these projects was an innovative effort to solve the serious housing problems of the period. Moreover, they reflected Mr. Rockefeller's abiding commitment to meaningful reform. He viewed his own efforts in the housing field as business rather than philanthropy. He believed that governmental housing in the form of either direct construction or subsidies would be ineffective and, in the long run, self-defeating. He proposed an alternative, one of "cooperation", which would allow capital a modest profit while providing the working and middle classes with modern, affordable housing, which they would eventually own. In this sense, Mr. Rockefeller's housing efforts were a subset of his more comprehensive belief that a rational and compassionate social order could be built through partnership and cooperation rather than through class conflict and governmental intervention.

Material on the Morningside Heights development constitutes the second largest bloc of documents in this series; there are four boxes covering the period 1946-1961. Unlike the other project files, the Morningside Heights folders are very fragmentary and superficial. Occasional memoranda on tenant relocation and construction questions are submerged within a sea of press releases, brochures, speeches, and technical reports. The story of Morningside Heights cannot be traced through these papers. What is included reflects Mr. David Rockefeller's involvement with the Morningside Heights Development Council and the concern for better public schools. The subsequent arguments over tenant dislocation, Columbia's role as a landlord, and the other issues which came to the fore after 1961 are simply not present in these files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Purchase of property from John Hicks. John D. Rockefeller, Sr. purchase of Halle and Sambrook properties. Deed of property to Coventry-Mayfield Land Company. Correspondents include John D. Rockefeller, Sr., E. V. Cary, J. G. Cowles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Purchase of property; payment of mortgage.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Purchase of property by John D. Rockefeller, Sr.; friendly sentiments; provision granting Sarah Sambrook lifetime right to occupy house.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - Forest Hill Fire, 12/17/17

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Report on fire. Appraisals of furniture and furnishings; power of attorney from John D. Rockefeller, Sr. to William S. Mitchell to collect money due for fire losses. Correspondents include W. B. Smith, Fred Kissock.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - D. E. Howatt

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Appointment as superintendent at Forest Hill; salary arrangements; resignation. Employment at Pocantico Hills. Correspondents include D. E. Howatt, John D. Rockefeller, Sr., John D. Rockefeller, Jr., J. Alva Jenkins.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - C. C. Jones

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Appointment as superintendent; salary arrangements; resignation. Correspondents include Charles O. Heydt, John D. Rockefeller, Jr., C. C. Jones, William Rudd, J. A. Jenkins.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Audit of books; payment of salaries; authorization to sign checks. Lists of furniture and furnishings. Correspondents include Frank Staley, Emery Stevens, James C. Jones.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - Office Matters - Termination Allowances

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: List of employees; termination of employment. Payment of termination allowances; provision for monthly annuity.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Proposed park scheme for disposition of Forest Hill; certificate of incorporation as Community Improvement Association; abandonment of idea. Correspondents include Starr J. Murphy, John D. Rockefeller, Sr., Robert W. Gumbel, A. L. Boulware.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - Park Matter - Declaration of Trust
Forest Hill Property - Park Matter - Declaration of Trust
Forest Hill Property - Cleveland Property - General

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Easement for sewer; fence around property; claims from former employees. Correspondents include Charles O. Heydt, Robert W. Gumbel, Phillip Keebler, C. C. Jones, Emery Stevens.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - Cleveland Property - N. A. Quilling

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: John D. Rockefeller, Sr. asked Quilling to investigate facts, values, locations, feasibility of development scheme; paid his expenses.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - Cleveland Property - Letter from H. McLaughlin

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Labor leader expressed laborers' appreciation for housing project.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - Cleveland Property - Patrick Lynch

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Lynch's illness and death; payment of hospital, funeral expenses. Settlement of estate. Death of Edward Lynch.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - Purchase by John D. Rockefeller, Jr.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Deed to entire real estate holdings in cleveland, East Cleveland and Cleveland Heights, from John D. Rockefeller, Sr. to John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Recording of deeds; appraisal of property. Correspondents include John D. Rockefeller, Sr., John D. Rockefeller, Jr., S. H. Holding, A. L. Boulware.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Development of plans for subdivision; valuation of property; completion of construction. Plans for recreational facilities; authorizations for expenditures for improvements. Use of McCurdy house; budgets; sale of other Cleveland properties. Correspondents include A. L. Boulware, C. C. Jones, Lester Slienkofer, A. L. Chipman, John D. Rockefeller, Sr., John D. Rockefeller, Jr., Nelson A. Rockefeller, Charles O. Heydt.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Development of plans for subdivision; valuation of property; completion of construction. Plans for recreational facilities; authorizations for expenditures for improvements. Use of McCurdy house; budgets; sale of other Cleveland properties. Correspondents include A. L. Boulware, C. C. Jones, Lester Slienkofer, A. L. Chipman, John D. Rockefeller, Sr., John D. Rockefeller, Jr., Nelson A. Rockefeller, Charles O. Heydt.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - W. B. Smith Correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Salary arrangements; permissions to use property and golf course; farm problems. Collection of rents; death of Smith. Correspondents include W. B. Smith, Charles O. Heydt, John D. Rockefeller, Sr., John D. Rockefeller, Jr., John D. Rockefeller 3rd, Frank Staley.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - Deed to Abeyton Realty Corporation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Quitclaim deeds from John D. Rockefeller, Jr. to Corporation for lands in East Cleveland and Cleveland Heights; Report on Cleveland housing situation; organization of Abeyton Realty Corporation. Correspondents include Joseph A. Schlitz, Charles O. Heydt, Phillip Keebler.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - Abeyton Realty Corporation Properties from John D. Rockefeller, Jr.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Costs of properties deeded by John D. Rockefeller, Jr. in July, 1931; deed of property at Belmore Road and Euclid Avenue to Abeyton Realty Corporation. Correspondents include Charles O. Heydt, Phillip Keebler, J. A. Schlitz.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Specifications of houses offered for sale; plans for construction; progress reports; John D. Rockefeller, Jr.'s assumption of mortgages. Dissatisfaction with Prudential.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Specifications of houses offered for sale; plans for construction; progress reports; John D. Rockefeller, Jr.'s assumption of mortgages. Dissatisfaction with Prudential.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - Euclid Avenue Purchase

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: March, 1927 purchase of East Cleveland property; collection of rents; purchase of property in subdivision, title placed in name of Cleveland Trust Co.; conveyance to Abeyton Realty Corporation. Correspondents include Charles O. Heydt, John D. Rockefeller, Jr., S. H. Holding, James C. Jones.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - Golf Course - John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Plans for recreational facilities at Forest Hill Development; layout of golf course. Lease of course to Abeyton Realty. Correspondents include John D. Rockefeller, Jr., Charles O. Heydt.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - S. H. Holding

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Value of Cleveland property; valuation for real estate purposes. Street lighting; Joseph Schlitz's illness. Bills for service rendered; death of Holding. Correspondents include: A. L. Boulware, S. H. Holding, Frank Staley, J. Schlitz, Simon Flexner, Thomas M. Debevoise.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - J. C. Jones

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bowman suit; denial of discrimination against Jews in sales program at Forest Hill. Construction of homes; maintenance of properties; rental of houses. Photograph of Gate Lodge; study of amendments to National Housing Act as applied to Forest Hill; installation of sidewalks; proposed layouts. Correspondents include Frank Staley, Robert W. Gumbel, Charles O. Heydt, James C. Jones, Emery Stevens, Joseph Schlitz.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - J. C. Jones - Illness and Salary

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Payment of salary; illness, death. Administration of estate; death of Mrs. Jones.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sales of property; plans and specifications for new homes. Downer's report on Development; offers to purchase property; sending of deeds. Correspondents include Charles O. Heydt, John D. Rockefeller, Jr., Lester Sleinkofer, Frank Staley, A. L. Chipman, Joseph Schlitz.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - New Housing - Defense Housing Project

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Suggested block layouts; plans for construction of two-family houses.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - New Housing - Proposed Selling Program

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Plan to stimulate sales of lots; adoption of new contracts with "loss participation clause"; revisions of "offer to purchase" agreements. Correspondents include Emery Stevens, A. L. Chipman, J. Schlitz, J. C. Jones, Frank Staley, Charles O. Heydt, Thomas M. Debevoise.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - Sale of Property to Harris and Rose, 1948

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1948 acceptance of offer to purchase; release of obligations for underground public installations; bills of sale; deeds.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - Sale of Property to Harris and Rose, 1948

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1948 acceptance of offer to purchase; release of obligations for underground public installations; bills of sale; deeds.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - Sale of Remaining Property - Hiles Claims

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Declination of offer to purchase unsold portion of Development; allotment to interest prospective sellers. Brief on Hiles claim for fee; rejection of claim. Correspondents include William A. Hiles, J. Schlitz, Frank Staley, A. J. Chapman, Phillip Keebler.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Appraisal of property; successful negotiations to purchase Rice interests in property; difficulties in dealing with Mrs. Rice. Correspondents include B. R. Deming, Mrs. William Rice, S. H. Holding, J. C. Jones, John D. Rockefeller, Jr., Charles O. Heydt, Thomas M. Debevoise.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - Kelvin House Construction

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Construction of demonstration home; opening ceremonies. Sales and advertising program. Correspondents include J. C. Jones, Frank Staley, John D. Rockefeller, Jr.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - Forest Hill - Miscellaneous Correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Plans for development of Forest Hill; offer of services from banks, etc. Applications for contracts. Correspondents include John D. Rockefeller, Jr., Charles O. Heydt, J. C. Jones, Thomas M. Debevoise, Frank Staley, A. R. Fraser.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - N. B. Geddes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Salary arrangements for survey of housing problem. Purchase and planting of trees. Sending of report to libraries. Correspondents include Norman Bel Geddes, Nelson A. Rockefeller, Charles O. Heydt, Earl Newsom.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - B. Geddes Report on Forest Hill
Forest Hill Property - B. Geddes Report on Forest Hill

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: School needs; maps, blueprints, printed materials, lease of property. School difficulties; Mrs. Grund's resignation from Board; closing of school. Summary of John D. Rockefeller, Jr.'s contributions to school; gift of use of houses for faculty. Correspondents include Joseph Schlitz, Frank Staley, A. L. Chipman, H. T. Clark, Thomas M. Debevoise, Charles O. Heydt.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - Park School - Deed to School, May 1932

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Gift of land to school; letters of thanks. School problems.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - Park School - Contributions to School

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Gift of houses for faculty's use; contributions to school budget.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - Park School - Loans and Finances

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: School's financial needs; John D. Rockefeller, Jr. declined to make gift, but granted loan. Repayment, extension of notes; letters of thanks from pupils for gift of land. Bankruptcy claim against school; purchase of property by Cleveland Jewish Center. Correspondents include Charles O. Heydt, H. T. Clark, Joseph Schlitz, John D. Rockefeller, Jr., Frank Staley, Phillip Keebler, Thomas M. Debevoise, J. C. Jones.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Maps, blueprints, cost estimates; John D. Rockefeller, Jr. praise of Work Progress Administration (WPA); tablet dedication. Correspondents include Robert W. Gumbel, John D. Rockefeller, Jr., Wilbur Watson.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - Gift of Land for Park
Forest Hill Property - Gift of Land for Park

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A. D. Taylor's study; plans to develop estate as public park. Cleveland Heights City Council approval of preliminary plan. Use of work relief money in development project. John D. Rockefeller, Jr.'s desire note to have name connected with park or lake; John D. Rockefeller, Jr. pleasure at development plans. Study of trees in park; fire at Guest Lodge; death of A. D. Taylor. Correspondents include F. C. Cain, F. Staley, L. Sleinkofer, J. Schlitz, A. D. Taylor, Charles Carran, A. L. Chipman, A. B. Williams, Robert W. Gumbel, Phillip Keebler, John D. Rockefeller, Jr.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - Gift of Land for Park - Clippings
Forest Hill Property - Gift of Land for Park - Letters of Appreciation
Forest Hill Property - Gift of Land for Park - Appraisals

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - Gift of Land for Park - Dugway Brook Culvert

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Covering brook property with culvert; agreement to cover only East Cleveland portion; deed to property, to get Work Progress Administration (WPA) funds for work. John D. Rockefeller, Jr. agrees to provide sponsor's share of construction costs.

did.unittitle: Forest Hill Property - Gift of Land for Park - Offer & Deeds

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Assessed valuation; payment of taxes; quitclaim deed of culvert and sewer premises. Agreement by John D. Rockefeller, Jr. and Cities of Cleveland Heights and East Cleveland for establishment of Forest Hill Park; costs of program. Correspondents include Phillip Keebler, Charles O. Heydt, Frank Staley, J. C. Jones, Charles Carran, Robert W. Gumbel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Offer of land; acceptance by East Cleveland City Commission and City Council of Cleveland Heights; John D. Rockefeller, Jr. letter of thanks for resolution.

scopecontent.p: Received from Charles O. Heydt; expenditures; cost of properties purchased from John D. Rockefeller, Jr.; monthly summary reports. Correspondents include John D. Rockefeller, Jr., Thomas M. Debevoise.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.p: John D. Rockefeller, Jr. subscribed to stock, assumed mortgages in construction of Sunnyside Gardens in Long Island City. 1936-1939 financial statements; plans for development of Radburn; mortgage strike among tenants; notices of meetings. Correspondents include Charles O. Heydt, Kenneth Chorley, Arthur Woods, Robert W. Gumbel, Thomas M. Debevoise, Phillip Keebler, Joh D. Rockefeller, Jr., A. M. Bing.

did.unittitle: City Housing Corporation - Col. Woods Correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A. M. Bing's housing scheme; Rockefeller office investigation of scheme. Construction progress of Sunnyvale Gardens; need for additional capital. Purchase of New Jersey land; construction of Radburn, with loan from John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Financial difficulties. Correspondents include Arthur Woods, Kenneth Chorley, Charles O. Heydt, Thomas M. Debevoise, John D. Rockefeller, Jr., A. M. Bing, H. Hoover, Beardsley Ruml.

Debevoise, John D. Rockefeller, Jr. , Charles O. Heydt.

scopecontent.p: Appeals; Pre-Built Housing Corporation inquiry. Laurance S. Rockefeller interest in aluminum pre-fabrication (McDonnel Aircraft Co.) and steel fabrication (Harman Homes); Laurance S. Rockefeller financed study by J. C. Rogers, Jr. Correspondents include Laurance S. Rockefeller.

Company policies; purchasing program. Correspondents include David Rockefeller, John D. Rockefeller, Jr., W. T. Lindquist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: City's arrangement with Home; city's sale to Home. Plans for building; transfer of property from Home to Empire Mortgage Company. Correspondents include Raymond B. Fosdick, Charles O. Heydt, Thomas M. Debevoise, A. J. Thomas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Decision to build; choosing of name; construction; renting. New York Chapter of American Institute of Architects award to Apartments. Upkeep; labor relations; transfer of apartments to John D. Rockefeller, Jr., then to Lawida Corporation. Correspondents include Charles O. Heydt, A. J. Thomas, Thomas M. Debevoise, Douglas Gibbons.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Profit and loss statements, 1932-1935; balance sheets, 1932-1934; statistical data statements for 1932. Correspondents include Phillip Keebler.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Collections; arrears; complaints; renewals. Correspondents include Charles O. Heydt.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copies of important papers, including Empire Mortgage Company deed to Lavoisier Apartments. Liquidation. Correspondents include Thomas M. Debevoise, Charles O. Heydt, Phillip Keebler.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Releases and newspaper articles. Correspondents include Charles O. Heydt, A. J. Thomas, Ivy Lee.
